title: Zelensky condemns deadly Russian drone strike on passenger train
desc: At least four people were killed when drones targeted a packed train in north-eastern Ukraine, officials say.

title: Judge rules Massachusetts offshore wind project halted by Trump administration can continue
desc: A federal judge said Tuesday that a nearly completed Massachusetts offshore wind project can continue, as the industry successfully challenges the Trump administration in court. At U.S. District Court in Boston, Judge Brian Murphy halted the administration's stop work order for Vineyard Wind, citing the potential economic losses from the delays and the developers' likelihood of success on their claims. Vineyard Wind is one of five big offshore wind projects on the East Coast that the Trump administration froze days before Christmas, citing national security concernsâ€” and the fourth that has since been allowed to go forward.

title: Trump, seeking damage control, weighs less aggressive approach in Minneapolis
desc: US President Donald Trump is considering a softer immigration approach in Minneapolis as his administration seeks to ease tensions following a deadly enforcement operation.

title: Donald Trump threatens Iraq against reelecting Maliki
desc: In a post on Truth Social, Trump warned that reinstalling Nouri al-Maliki would be a "very bad choice" for Iraq.

title: 5 snubs and surprises that could impact the Oscar race
desc: Kate Hudson proves her Best Actress bonafides, while supporting actor victories for Amy Madigan and Delroy Lindo may have gotten more complicated.

title: B.C.'s attorney general urges Canadian businesses to 'think about their role' in supporting ICE operations
desc: B.C. billionaire Jim Pattison and Vancouver-based Hootsuite are among the Canadian companies facing backlash for business ties to United States Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE).
